intro: Ciliaria merkii, commonly known as the Merk's ciliate, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers. Ciliaria merkii typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying tropical flora.
